message.body: hi mrs whalley
ughh that sounds terrible. please dont ever say that again.
they all sound terrible
agreed. working from home?
you know it! still in pjs and its glorious
what are you up to?
must be nice.
it IS nice actually.
just got off the phone, sorry
ugh who are you talking to so early??
talking to a`guy about a job
ahh that makes sense.
which one is this?
cable job in elkton area
elkton huh? hows your night time mindless job going? quit yet?
nope, its ok. got another week
gotcha. any good plans for the holidays?
nope
fuck the holidays
how bout you?
ok scrooge. I am actually quite excited about the holidays. Not doing antyhing crazy--just making the usual rounds amongst parents houses etc.
and i have some time off which is nice
thats nice. Cathy and I split up, so ive got reason to be crabby
wait, what?? when and how did this occur?
and you were acting rather disinterested in that whole situation last time we talked..
it was about a`week ago, we had plans to hang out and she flaked
we talked, she said she needs some solo time
well, emailed i should say
well i mean, this doesnt strike me as something that should come as all together surprising
plus its around the holidays, and thats awkward
it doesnt but things have been going really well lately and i was planning a trip after christmas together
YOU were, or both of you were planning a trip?
it is a little, i mean we didnt really know what to expect from each other
we talked about it
well maybe its just a temporary kind of thing
she agreed, I was the one making arramgements
did you start seeing some type of potential with her or what?
i dunno. im confused. i really are about her. her divorce is going to be finalized soon
*care
ohh andresss, youre such a mess.
and when her divorce is finalized, is that going to make a difference to you?
I mean am i being stupid? could it ever work?
it sounds like she may need to take a break around the holidays and then itll pick back up
why COULDNT it ever work?
yes, ive always told her i couldnt commit 100% until then
i never understood your whole philosophy on that anyway
ohh
well, so was that the only thing holding you back from pursuing a relationship with her seriously?
yes, I mean there were a few other things too but weve been seeing each other for 10 months and we both really like each other

She said that shes had a lot on her mind lately and needs to sort some things out but wants to be friends. I dont really know what to do, I told her that I miss her and will give her some time but would like to see her after xmas

i think its natural for her to have a lot of things on her mind right now. This is probabaly her first holiday season without her ex around in a lonnngg time which is probably hard for her, let a lone the kids. Plus she obviously doesnt know how to feel about your guys' 'relationship' or how to define it right now and everything is muddled. Not to mention the fact that she is probably trying to gain some real closure with the ex if the final divorce decree is upcoming.

shes putting you on the back burner right now so she can figure some stuff out. Give her some time and see how it goes. Shell probably have a little more clarity after all of the chaos of the holidays are over.
thats how i feel. i always thought that she might not go through w/ the divorce, which is one reason i was always so reluctant. I want to give her space but i miss her and i dont want to confuse her
youve always thought she may not go through with the divorce?? why is that??
just try to keep yourself occupied--you WILL confuse her and smother her if you try to talk to her all the time right now. Give her an opportunity to miss you too.

I dont know why, i mean its not that unusual for people to have second thoughts. I know i just have to ride it out and see what happens. lastt thing i told her was to let me know if she wants to get together after xmas (she has that week off)
well then the ball is in her court. if she wants to see you, she will.
it sounds like you were more attached to her than you thought mister..
yeah its changed recently
and why do you think that is?
weve been so backand forth though i feel she may have given up on us
it started when i went to mass, i missed her when i went away and had a lot of time to think about us being together like a couple
the timing just SUCKS with the holidays and all but were both kinda busy so t might be for the best
well does she know that youve recently had a bit of a change of heart or have you kept this to yourself?
no i told her
this isnt the first time you guys have taken a 'break' right?
and what did she say?
nope
once over the summer, rather short lived
she just said that she really cares for me but just wants to friends, those dreaded words

haha well again, i think that its poor timing and that played a large factor in her response. More of an attachment on your side at this particular time may have pushed her away and made her a little bit wary. Or amde her realize that she needs time to really figure stuff out.
how long were her and her ex married/together for anyway?
part of me feels like we started to get close and it scared her, especially since shes pretty jaded about relationships right now
could be
about 8 years, but only a few happy ones
gotcha
wellllll, give it a little time--not too much longer until the holidays are through
like you said, ball is in her court. i asked her what she wants and she said she has no idea and needs to figure that out
well then giver her the time to do that.
how old is she again?
the fact that shes put up w/ me this long says a lot but she might just not have it in her anymore
almost exactly a year older than I
hahaha
shes young, and resilient. she wants another relationship and just doesnt know it yet.
or maybe doesnt want it yet. but she will.
she says the time away from her girls really gets to her esp during the holidays and she misses being a family
well YEA, im sure thats probably the toughest part
the whole 'family' concept
not to sound overly conceited, but she must be nuts to not want to be with me
WHAT?! how could you type that and think that there was ANY way that that statement could come across as anything but overly conceited??
I asked her if she was having second thoughts about the divorce, it doesnt sound like she is
well thats a good sign
not saying that Im perfect but I think Im a pretty good guy. I respect and treat her well
by the sounds of it the last guy wasnt all that
that doesnt default to her absoultely wanting to be with you you psycho
there a plenty of good guys out there that will respect women adn treat them well
obviously
name one
its dependent on the individual woman/guy goofball. you are NOT the only choice.
...err three
oh and you know what, i CAN name one guy that treated me well and was genuinely a good guy.
true but we dated for close to a year and never argued or anything
could jsut be because youre not close enough to argue yet lol
itll happen
I just need to clear my head. just sucks cause winter is right around the corner and my SAD is kicking in
ohh you mean your self diagnosed SAD?
so go out and do something
did you work last night/work tonight?
yes
im suppose to meet up w/ friend later
who? and shouldnt you be sleeping or something right now?

I dunno. I think part of it is Im just lonely. I never thought we would make a great match but we really do like each other a lot and I don't see why we shouldnt try to work on something that makes us happy. I probably should be, yes
are you just getting sentimental now because she cut things off with you do ya think? She is trying to figure out WHAT makes her happy right now is all.
once she gets that down, she can work on the getting there part
I think that is part of it but Ive been moving in that direction for a while, always get stuck on the divorce thing.
i dont know why lol its not like shes still seeing him--its just a formality
Im ok with just being friends, who knows maybe we will get back together
yeppers
I know, its stupid
it sounds like thats what shes trying to figure out sooo shes working on it
part of me wants to tell her that I dont care about that anymore but its too late now. Oh, and I send her flowers for Christmas. I didnt know what else to get her. You think thats a mistake?

yeaa too late to tell her that you dont care about the divorce thing--that wouldnt change her need/decision to take some time to sort things out. And considering that you guys are just 'friends' right now, you def shouldnt be getting her anything else more than flowers. I think the flowers are ok though--its a nice gesture.
ok. thanks punk. youre the bestttt
hahaha i knoowww :)
shit will work itself out--im sure youll resume some type of 'relationship' after things settledown
I hope so. The fact that we dated so long should have been a sign. I feel a little foolish but hey what can you do. If its meant to be it will work itself out
Imma try and get some sleep now
why feel foolish??
ok go to bed
youre prolly half delusional right now anyway
If I had been more willing to see past the little stuff then maybe we could have moved past it. Gnite punk!
gnite!
